summary: Player Home with alot of containers and displays.
descriptionHtml:
*Read note Before updating*

Winter\'s Edge is Player Home with copious amounts of storage space and displays. Its separated into two parts, the house and the basement. The house is more for your companions, having been built with [url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/18045]My Home Is Your Home[/url] in mind. The Basement includes a smithy, enchanting and alchemy stands, chest room, library, displays for shields, weapons, daggers, and armor, \"Owned\" player bed, and an archery lane. The displays all come empty.  

Currently there are no quests or balancing agents of any kind, so while I did not make this as a cheat mod, its a free house. I might fix that later, though that\'s a big maybe.

Notes:
*Remove everything from first floor displays before updating to 1.2 or higher*
If you didn\'t do that, either revert to 1.1 and then remove them, or use \"tcl\" to go through the wall and get your stuff off the walls.

There are many mannequins in the basement. If you have a mod that changes their behavior, it can cause your game to crash due to the scripts all being run at once. That\'s really only an issue on lower end machines.

Changes:
1.3
Fixed Cell resetting
Fixed Chest near basement ladder respawning
Added weapon rack on tree by the chopping block
Tweaked Smithy

1.2
Fixed clipping and positioning issues
Added small chests to library
Added plaques to the library
Added barrel for food on 1st floor
Added 2 small chests to second floor
Added wooden walls to fix weapons on plaques clipping into stone walls
Added a few more idle markers
Added table to basement
Added woodpiles around outside
Added/tweaked outside lighting

1.1
removed a bush sticking out of a rock
added light to a fire
added more exterior lights
killed bug causing hundreds of chests across Skyrim to be labeled \"Merchant Chest\" and have no loot
(sorry about that last one)
minor navmesh tweaks
moved map marker so if you fast travel on a horse it doesn\'t end up on the door step
author: SatanSoldier
